page.title: 04The Lang Rigg above Gourdon
page.content: The{Lang Rigg}is a track which runs from Benholm to the farm track which runs up to Hallgreen Mains and it is nearly 2 miles long. The Lang Rigg used to be the old coastal road. The {wind pump}you can see was used to pump water up to Middle Knox. On the summit of{Gourdon Hill}there is a long cairn. The cairn which is a{Neolithic burial {place}is now composed of small rounded boulders and angular stones with some earth covered with turf and whins. It measures 46m in length, 14m wide and 1.7m high. Near the cairn, on the edge of the summit of Gourdon Hill you get a great view of Gourdon. In fact the Lang Rigg itself is an enjoyable walk with some good coastal views looking down to Gourdon and over to Bervie.
